gt_metadata.note: Freeform Stacking: Leah reviews entire document including CP redlines. Representing party is SAME as Freeform Baseline.

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Buyer shall pay all invoices within thirty (30) days of invoice date. Late payments bear interest at 1% per month.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Buyer shall pay all invoices within fifteen (15) days of invoice date. Supplier may suspend deliveries if payment is late.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Revert to baseline: Net 30 payment terms. Reject 15-day requirement and unilateral suspension rights.
key_elements: 1) Minimum 30-day payment terms 2) Suspension requires cure period and notice 3) Standard commercial terms
acceptable_variations: May add: 2% early payment discount for 10 days
May clarify: suspension requires 15 days notice and cure opportunity
May add: late payment protections for Supplier
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: 15 days insufficient for AP cycles; suspension needs due process; industry standard is Net 30

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Supplier warrants Products shall be free from defects in materials and workmanship for one (1) year from delivery.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Supplier warrants Products free from defects for sixty (60) days from delivery, excluding normal wear, improper use, unauthorised modifications, environmental damage, and third-party components.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Revert to baseline: One (1) year warranty from delivery. Reject 60-day reduction and extensive exclusions.
key_elements: 1) Minimum 12 months warranty 2) From delivery date 3) Reasonable exclusions only
acceptable_variations: May add: reasonable exclusions (misuse, unauthorised modification)
unacceptable_responses: Normal wear excluded (reasonable but needs definition)
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: 60 days grossly inadequate; automotive industry standard 12-24 months; many defects manifest beyond 60 days

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Supplier's total liability shall not exceed amounts paid by Buyer for Products in the twelve (12) months preceding the claim.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Supplier's total liability shall not exceed the lesser of product price or $50,000.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Revert to baseline: 12-month product payments cap. Reject fixed $50K ceiling.
key_elements: 1) Cap tied to 12-month product payments 2) Proportional to relationship value 3) No arbitrary low fixed cap
acceptable_variations: May add: carve-outs for IP, gross negligence, willful misconduct
unacceptable_responses: Lesser of product price or fixed amount
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: $50K inadequate for automotive supply relationship; cap should scale with purchase volume

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement upon 180 days written notice.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Supplier may terminate upon 30 days notice. Buyer may not terminate for convenience.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Revert to baseline: Either party may terminate on 180 days notice. Reject asymmetric provision.
key_elements: 1) Symmetric termination rights 2) Reasonable notice period (90-180 days) 3) Both parties can terminate for convenience
acceptable_variations: May compromise: 90 days notice for both
May add: payment for work in progress
unacceptable_responses: Supplier 30 days while Buyer cannot terminate
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: Buyer needs termination flexibility for supply strategy changes; asymmetric provision creates vendor lock-in

part_b_whole_document.note: Part B uses the Freeform Baseline GT. Same contract, same issues. Evaluate whether Leah still detects these risks when CP redlines are present.

part_c_document_quality.scope: Every redline Leah produces in the output .docx

per_redline_capture.linked_gt_id: GT ID if NEW_REDLINE addresses Part B issue, else null
per_redline_capture.action_executed: ACCEPT | MODIFY | REJECT | ADD | DELETE | NONE
per_redline_capture.insertion_accuracy: 0-2 | NA (aligned pair average, NA for DELETE/simple swaps)

aggregation_rules.quality_fields: Averaged across evaluations; median used for divergent scores
